page.title: 01FARMLAND - VALE OF PICKERING
page.content: This area is immediately to the south of the market town of Pickering. It is on the edge of the Vale of Pickering and was in the past part of the Lake of Pickering. The area is flat, the soil is heavy and does not drain readily. It is drained by the Costa Beck and Pickering Beck, both are a source of pleasure to fishermen. There are very few trees and the land is mostly arable growing wheat and barley, there are areas of grass for sheep and cattle. The few farms are scattered but well kept. The north east corner is part of Roger's Nurseries and successfully grows roses and trees used for landscaping etc. There is also a small timber yard producing props for the coal mining industry. The centre of the southern area borders on Flamingo Park Zoo. It has a small estate of bungalows and
